question: How can i lose this belly?
question_content: hi im 14 and i am overweight. not to the point where its severe just all the weight is mostly in my mid section and i feel like if i lost that my self esteem would shoot up. please what can i do. nice answers only:/ id like tips from people who have actually lost weight

answers.answer_content:
Running, jogging, cycling, swimming, dancing, push ups, sit ups, squats, brisk walking and power walking all help for weight loss but dieting helps more.

Stubborn belly fat is very hard to lose, even for very thin people.

You need to reduce or avoid your intake of junk sugar as in sweets, desserts, cakes, cookies and biscuits. White rice and white bread also need to be avoided.

You can see further exercise tips and further diet tips in a web search for "how to lose stubborn belly fat".

Weight Loss is a very easy concept to grasp once you have required enough knowledge on the subject. http://boyels.com is where I first started my weight loss goals. After reading the site and watching the video I decided to give it a try.  Nine months later I was 78 pounds lighter and had a visible 4 pack of abs (still working on that 6 pack). You just got to remember no matter what you’re doing to lose weight you can never give up and have to always push yourself further than the day before because at the end of the day the amount of weight you lose is entirely up to you. I truly wish you the very best wishes for your journey down weight lost.

Hey Joshua. I'm a personal trainer and a nutritionist, so here is my advice. Start my finding out what you are eating everyday. Does it contain a lot of sugars, fats, and unhealthy carbohydrates? Try to convert those to healthier foods. Switch soda to water, chocolate bars to low-fat granola bars during snacktime, and fill you ate with more greens! 

Secondly, start an exercise plan. You'll have to start slow at first. Organize a time during the day when you can run, start with 30 minutes jog/walk, then slowly get rid of the walking, and eventually run for longer periods of time. 

Exercises for the entire body is important, especially cardio, but midsection workout is important too, look up examples of midsection workouts, but of course, the crunch is a good option.

Sports can also help, swimming is a great way to get in shape, and staying active will help you in the long run

Best of luck! Hope everything works out!

Well there's no way to target your weight loss in a specific point of your body, so just aiming to lose weight in general would be your best option. I suggest lots of cardio (walking, running, stuff that gets your blood pumping) and a change in diet. Eat more fruits, vegetables, proteins, and complex carbohydrates, less saturated fats, sugars, and simple carbohydrates, but also all around eating less food. Now don't starve yourself! But try to stay in the 1200-1400 calorie range. The trick to weight loss is burning off more calories than you consume (one pound of fat is 3500 calories) so it will take a while to lose a lot of weight. 

ALSO. One thing you absolutely do not want to do, if you're looking to lose weight, is crunches. Crunches help you build abs, yes, but if you don't lose the weight first your abs will just be hiding under a big pile of belly.

Start running or walking, or doing some sort of cardio. 30 minutes 3-5 times a week can help take weight off quickly. Make sure you drink plenty of water during your day, it helps keep your metabolism up. Fruits and veggies are also great sources of energy and fiber :)
